resources.string: Music Theory 30 Days
Day 1: What are Notes?
Introduction to musical notes (A, B, C, D, E, F, G) and their representation.
Day 2: Clefs (Treble & Bass)
Understanding the Treble Clef (G-clef) and Bass Clef (F-clef) and how they indicate pitch.
Day 3: The Musical Staff
Learning about the 5 lines and 4 spaces of the staff and how notes are placed on it.
Day 4: What is a Scale?
Introducing the concept of a musical scale - a sequence of notes ordered by pitch.
Day 5: The Major Scale
Understanding the pattern of whole and half steps that make up a major scale (W-W-H-W-W-W-H).
Day 6: Intervals
The distance in pitch between two notes. Introduction to basic intervals (seconds, thirds, etc.).
Day 7: What are Chords?
Defining chords as combinations of three or more notes played simultaneously.
Day 8: Basic Triads (Major & Minor)
Building the most common type of chord - the triad. Constructing major and minor triads.
Day 9: Introduction to Rhythm
Understanding rhythm as the pattern of durations of notes and silences in music.
Day 10: Time Signatures (4/4)
Explaining the meaning of time signatures, focusing on the common 4/4 time (common time).
Day %1$d: Topic Title
Detailed explanation for the topic of Day %1$d will go here. Keep learning!
Day 30: Review & Next Steps
Congratulations! You\'ve completed the 30-day basics. Review key concepts and explore further learning resources.
